meanings.definition: The action of annexing something, especially territory.
meanings.sent1: The annexation of the new land was celebrated by the townspeople.
meanings.sent2: The country's annexation of the neighboring island was met with mixed reactions.
meanings.sent3: During the game of Monopoly, the player's annexation of Boardwalk led to victory.
meanings.sent4: Her annexation of the top position in the company was swift and strategic.
meanings.sent5: The annexation of knowledge through reading is a lifelong pursuit.

meanings.definition: The formal act of acquiring something, especially territory.
meanings.sent1: The treaty outlined the terms of annexation between the two nations.
meanings.sent2: The king signed the decree of annexation, officially claiming the new lands.
meanings.sent3: The penguin's annexation of the fish bucket at the zoo was quite a spectacle.
meanings.sent4: Her annexation of the title 'Queen of the Dance Floor' was well-deserved.
meanings.sent5: The annexation of the championship trophy brought tears of joy to the team.

meanings.definition: The process of adding something, especially territory, to a larger whole.
meanings.sent1: The annexation of the smaller provinces into the empire strengthened its power.
meanings.sent2: The company's annexation of the competitor's market share was a strategic move.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel's annexation of all the acorns in the park caused a shortage.
meanings.sent4: Her annexation of new skills into her repertoire made her a versatile performer.
meanings.sent5: The annexation of diverse cultures into one community enriched everyone's lives.
